N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 347.23 - Request for redetermination

State Regulations
(a) Any social services district which has
been denied State reimbursement or which has received official departmental
notification of an intention to deny reimbursement, for failing to meet its
portion of the annual collections goal may request a redetermination. (b) The request shall be submitted to the
department in writing within 90 days after the denial of
reimbursement. (c) the request
shall specify in detail: (1)
the amount of
the redetermination sought; (2)
the
factors that caused the district to fail to meet its collections
goal; (3)
an explanation of how
such factors caused the failure to meet the collections goal; (4)
that such factors are not administrative
and processing functions or organizations subject to the jurisdiction of the
local legislative body; (5)
the
basis for paragraph (4) of this subdivision; and
(6)
other relevant information required by
this subdivision. (d) The commissioner, or his designee(s), may request a social services district, and such district shall comply with the request, for any additional information
relevant to the request for a redetermination. The additional information shall
become a part of the original request. (e) The commissioner, or his/her designee(s), shall review the request for a redetermination and make findings of fact and a
determination based on the findings of fact. The commissioner, at his/her
option, may afford the social services district an opportunity to make an oral
presentation of its position. (f) Upon a determination by the commissioner or his/her designee(s) that the
failure of the social services district to meet its collections goal was due in
whole or in part to factors other than those administrative and processing
functions or organizations which are subject to the jurisdiction of such
district's local legislative body, the commissioner shall waive such failure in
whole or in part and shall restore all or a corresponding portion of any State
reimbursement previously denied for a failure to meet its collections
goal. (g) The district shall
receive: (1)
a copy of the findings of
fact; (2)
a copy of the
determination; and
(3)
notification
of the commissioner's final action thereupon. (h) Unless there has been an intervening
relevant change of circumstances, any findings of fact or determination in a
prior review may be used as a basis for a finding of fact or determination of
subsequent request of such district. The burden of showing that there has been
an intervening relevant change of circumstances is upon such
district. (i) A pending request for
a redetermination shall not stay a denial of reimbursement. Notes
